title: font from an ad
content:
I am looking for some nice modern san serif font that is nice enough for heading and also sub menus.

Something like this. Any links to foundry sites would be much appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828095333im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0311_3745.JPG)

 [‹ Senior Shirts Font!!!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828095333/http:/typophile.com/node/43001 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help me with a few typefaces? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828095333/http:/typophile.com/node/42904 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kidcranium

comments.content:
[Enabler (David James, Alias)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828095333/http:/www.identifont.com/show?1BR)  
 [Progress (Gareth Hagues, Alias)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828095333/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ALT0000138#flont)

_»Progress is developed from another Alias typeface, Enabler. It features the pinched forms and strategically positioned curves of Enabler, but has purified, rounder, more organic forms, and has been fleshed out into 5 weights. Progress is a fluid, streamlined and dynamic type for short blocks of text and headline use.«_
cool thank you Renko for the quick reply, this font is so beautiful.
additionally, what is this font below? thanks so much for helping a newbie!!!
